channel.title: Homes on Van der Laan & Science
channel.description: Recent content in Homes on Van der Laan & Science

item.description: Biography I am an assistant professor in the Central Diagnostics Laboratory which is part of the Circulatory Health Program at the University Medical Center Utrecht and University of Utrecht and work with professor dr. Folkert W. Asselbergs and professor dr. Gerard Pasterkamp. My research interest is focused on the genetic and epigenetic causes of carotid and coronary atherosclerosis underlying ischemic stroke (IS) and coronary artery disease (CAD), and their intermediate traits such as carotid intima media thickness (cIMT) and arterial calcification.

item.title: Grants
item.description: Here’s a list of some of my successes (marked with üòÅ ) and failures (marked with üôà), because “the only real mistake is the one from which we learn nothing.” [Henry Ford]. 401.16.061: The genetics of carotid and aortic gene expression: replicating expression profiles and expression quantitative trait loci in the Athero-Express and Abdominal Aortic Aneurysm Express Biobank Studies | Grant total: ‚Ç¨ 150,000.- | Received: üôà | NWO (Den Haag, Zuid-Holland, Netherlands) CP2013-63: Genotyping of the Abdominal Aortic Aneurysm-Express Biobank Study | Grant total: ‚Ç¨50,000.

item.title: Teaching
item.description: I am one of the lecturers for the following courses and years: BMW32416: Vascular Biology (since 2010) | BSc Biomedical Sciences | University of Utrecht GNBA221506: Healthy arteries: the role of the arterial wall and the circulation (since 2010) | BSc Medicine | University of Utrecht MSc Epidemiology: Cardiovascular genetics: Mendelian Randomisation and power (since 2017) | MSc Epidemiology | Julius Center - University Medical Center Utrecht You can find the teaching material here at the lectures project.
